text: The New York City mayoral election of 1945 took place on November 6, 1945 in New York City. The candidates were King County District Attorney William O'Dwyer, a Democrat, and Jonah J. Goldstein, a Republican judge, as well as other, third party candidates. O'Dwyer won the contest with 56.77% of the vote. ==References== Mayoral election, 1945 1945 New York City mayoral Category:1945 United States mayoral elections Category:November 1945 events
title: 1945 New York City mayoral election
